Right now, we scale down y by (1-p) in training mode via this piece of code: .div_(1 - self.p).

This is done so that models at test time do not need to have scaling (and can entirely remove the dropout layer).

v1 behavior is to not scale anything in training mode but instead scale in test mode.

Keep current behavior as-is with scale_train=True (default value). and if scale_train=False, then instead do no scaling in train mode, but do scaling in test mode.

body:
Right now, we scale down `y` by `(1-p)` in training mode via this piece of code: `.div_(1 - self.p)`.

This is done so that models at test time do not need to have scaling (and can entirely remove the dropout layer).

`v1` behavior is to not scale anything in training mode but instead scale in test mode.

Keep current behavior as-is with `scale_train=True` (default value). and if `scale_train=False`, then instead do no scaling in train mode, but do scaling in test mode.
